All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class GraphWithAnimLine
extends ExamplesGraph

As ExamplesGraph but displays a line which can be animated.

Author:
Sam Stokes
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

GraphWithAnimLine

public GraphWithAnimLine(int w,
                         int h,
                         int[] xs,
                         int[] ys,
                         boolean[] cs,
                         ExtendedLine l)
Create a new graph with an animated line which rotates around the centre of the graph area.

Parameters:
w - width in pixels of the graph area.
h - height in pixels of the graph area.
xs - x-coords of the points to plot.
ys - y-coords of the points to plot.
cs - labels of the points to plot.
l - line to draw.

GraphWithAnimLine

public GraphWithAnimLine(int w,
                         int h,
                         int[] xs,
                         int[] ys,
                         boolean[] cs,
                         ExtendedLine l,
                         LineAnimator a)
Create a new graph with animated line.

Parameters:
w - width in pixels of the graph area.
h - height in pixels of the graph area.
xs - x-coords of the points to plot.
ys - y-coords of the points to plot.
cs - labels of the points to plot.
l - line to draw.
a - animator specifying how the line should be animated.
Method Detail

init

public void init(int[] xs,
                 int[] ys,
                 boolean[] cs,
                 ExtendedLine l,
                 LineAnimator a)
Initialise the graph and begin the animation after 5 seconds.
If the graph has already been initialised, this will reset it, discarding the previous data and line and halting the animator.

Parameters:
xs - x-coords of the points to plot.
ys - y-coords of the points to plot.
cs - labels of the points to plot.
l - line to draw.
a - animator specifying how the line should be animated.

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
Overrides:
paint in class ExamplesGraph

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Test code: tests this with a perceptron on some random data.
